ngiemboon: Aa mèŋ Jÿâg, e faʼa fàʼ Ssé, mbɔɔ ye Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Yěsô Keleto. N náa yɔɔn ŋwàʼne á mbwó pi púɔ Ssé pie ée na mengẅɛ̀ ndá pà Ésàlayɛ ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a né legém, mbà pɔ́ léen sa jʉʼ ntsèm tsɛ̀ɛ mengwòŋ. N tsyɛʼté gẅí.
en: James,   a servant of God  # 1:1 Ac 16:17; Rm 1:1; Eph 6:6; Jms 1:1; 1Pt 2:16; Rv 1:1 and of the Lord Jesus Christ:

ngiemboon: Mefɛ̌ pɔ́ɔn, ngʉ̀ngʉ̀ mentí mentí lɔɔn ńne ńkúu gẅí, pi lɔg pɔ́ kwàʼ lekág ńkẅé.
en: Consider it a great joy, my brothers and sisters, whenever you experience various trials,

ngiemboon: Ńdɔgɔ ńkẅé púʼu, á nue pi ne ńzsé ngie, pi lɔɔn shÿɔg ngʉ̀ngʉ̀ gie e ne ńkúu gẅí, ḿbiŋ ńne ńkẅiʼi ńzába ntʉ́m gẅí na Ssé, mbà pi ge ne tʉte tʉte.
en: because you know that the testing of your faith produces endurance.

ngiemboon: Táʼ, á poŋ ngie letʉ̀te ŋwɛ́ à faʼa yé fàʼ tà ńcʉ́me, ńzsé ngie pi ge cʉ́ʼ melÿò, é kuʼ pʉ̀a Ssé, atsɔ́ mmó le zága na pi wɔ́.
en: And let endurance have its full effect, so that you may be mature and complete, lacking nothing.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi, ńtyé na nò, azsénò zága yé, á lúɔ mbwó Ssé, mbà Ssé ge ná. Á nue e Ssé zɔɔn ńdɔg pɔ́ ntʉ́m mbòŋo ńnáa mmó mbwó wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ té zẅɛ́te.
en: Now if any of you lacks wisdom, he should ask God #— #who gives to all generously and ungrudgingly #— #and it will be given to him.

ngiemboon: Tá ngàŋ ké ńcʉ́ʼʉ lélúɔ, ńzáb ntʉ́m wé na Ssé té ne ḿmʉ́ʼte, á nue nyìŋ gẅie à mʉʼté, à gwɔ́ pɔ́ páʼ kanúʼ gie á tyé ndùm ntse, fèfà ne ńdɔgɔ ḿbʉʉ, ńdɔgɔ ńcwóŋo la.
en: But let him ask in faith without doubting.   For the doubter is like the surging sea, driven and tossed by the wind.

ngiemboon: Tà ntí nyìŋ páʼ wɛ̌, kwaŋ ngie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ge náa tsɔ́ lága mmó né yé,
en: That person should not expect to receive anything from the Lord,

ngiemboon: mélàʼmie nyìŋ páʼ wɛ̌, te gɔɔn tsɔ́ nò tà ńtÿɔ́gɔ kwò mǒ wɔ́. À kwaŋa lépʉ, ńgíŋe ńkwaŋa lécwóŋ pɔ́ fʉʼó.
en: being double-minded and unstable in all his ways.  ,# 1:8 Jms 4:8; 2Pt 2:14

ngiemboon: Á poŋ ngie fɛ̌ wege gẅie aa fÿɔg, à kág, á nue e Ssé ŋǎʼ nzẅìŋ wé.
en: Let the brother of humble circumstances boast in his exaltation,

ngiemboon: Agẅie aa ngàŋa mmó, à kág yé, á nue e Ssé kéen sẅíʼi nzẅìŋ wé, tà á zsé ngie à ge láʼ mag yé pɔ́ páʼ tôtǒ maga na legǐ la.
en: but let the rich boast in his humiliation because he will pass away like a flower of the field.

ngiemboon: Nèm tʉ̌a tɛʼ, ńtuɔ legǐ, á pÿɛ́, tôtǒ gwe, awe lepòŋ lɔgɔ ḿmaga, áa ndʉŋndʉŋ páʼ ngàŋa mmó ge gÿo gwáʼ mefàʼ mé é kwé.
en: For the sun rises and, together with the scorching wind, dries up the grass; its flower falls off, and its beautiful appearance perishes. In the same way, the rich person will wither away while pursuing his activities.

ngiemboon: Ashÿó mbòŋo, aa nyìŋ gẅie ngʉ̀ngʉ̀ kúu yé á tʉte tʉte, á nue, páʼ ngʉ̀ngʉ̀ lʉŋté yé á tʉte tʉte la, e Ssé ge tɔʼ ngǔʼ twó yé. E lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ legwɔ́ temì gẅie à la kaʼa mbwó wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ gẅie à kwoŋo yé Ssé.
en: Blessed is the one who endures trials, because when he has stood the test he will receive the crown   of life that God  # 1:12 Other mss read that the Lord has promised to those who love him.  # 1:12 Mt 10:22; Jms 2:5

ngiemboon: Nkwàʼte lɔɔn ńké ńtóo na ngàŋ, tà á gɔɔn ngie: «Nkwàʼte yɔɔn fóo mbwó Ssé.» Á nue à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ e Ssé le gẅiin kwaŋte légÿo nò tepòŋ wɔ́, kwàʼ yé ké le tsóte nyìŋ ngie à gÿo nò tepòŋ wɔ́.
en: No one undergoing a trial should say, “I am being tempted by God,” since God is not tempted by evil, and he himself doesn’t tempt anyone.

ngiemboon: Eye ntí letsɔ̌ɔn shúm zɔ shwoŋte yé, á gwe na lejÿɔʼ.
en: But each person is tempted when he is drawn away and enticed by his own evil desire.

ngiemboon: Letsɔ̌ɔn shúm ŋwɛ́ gwɔ́ tà ńgáʼ, ńkẅɛɛ nò tepòŋ, anò tepòŋ gáʼ ńkẅɛɛ legwé.
en: Then after desire has conceived, it gives birth to sin, and when sin is fully grown, it gives birth to death.

ngiemboon: Mefɛ̌ pɔ́ɔn petʉ̀nzẅìŋ, tà nkwaŋá gẅí fʉte gẅí.
en: Don’t be deceived, my dear brothers and sisters.

ngiemboon: Afùʼ gie á poŋ tɛʼ, mbɔɔ ntsɔʼɔ́fàʼ wembòŋo pú fóo pɔ́ tÿǒ lepwó, á mbwó Ssé gie e la nyɛte nèm lâ mecÿɔ́ʼsaŋ á lefaŋ. À te kúbe, ńké te nzěm gẅiin.
en: Every good and perfect gift is from above, coming down from the Father of lights, who does not change like shifting shadows.

ngiemboon: Yé zɔ la kwoŋ, ńdɔgɔ shwóŋè gie áa nénʉ́, ńgÿo pege tsẅɛ́, légwɔ́ gie pege ge gwɔ́ mbwó yé, é gwɔ́ ntwó mmó na ngwòŋo kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie à la gÿo.
en: By his own choice, he gave us birth by the word of truth so that we would be a kind of firstfruits of his creatures.

ngiemboon: Mefɛ̌ pɔ́ɔn petʉ̀nzẅìŋ, pi zsé ngie áa mbòŋ mbwó nyìŋ, lézsé lézẅíʼte nò gie mé gɔɔn, ḿbiŋ ńgɔɔn yé nò, á kuʼ kuʼ, é ké le lwo ńgyáŋa lóŋ wɔ́,
en: My dear brothers and sisters, understand this: Everyone should be quick to listen, slow to speak, and slow to anger,

ngiemboon: mélàʼmie nyìŋ lɔɔn ńgyáŋa lóŋ, mbà à těen ńdɔgɔ ńgÿo mmó gie áa ndʉŋndʉŋ mvfò Ssé wɔ́.
en: for human anger does not accomplish God’s righteousness.

ngiemboon: Púʼu la, pi gwáʼ menò ncÿǒ ntsèm, ńgwáʼa mà gẅie à fóo na lecÿɔ̌g cÿɔ́g. Pi lɔgɔ kwɔ̀gɔnnɛ́ ńzẅíŋe shwóŋè gie Ssé ka pye tsɛ̀ɛ ntʉ́m pi. Á nue á kuʼu légÿo pi tsẅɛ́.
en: Therefore, ridding yourselves of all moral filth and the evil that is so prevalent,   humbly receive the implanted word, which is able to save your souls.  # 1:21 Eph 1:13; 4:22; Col 3:8

ngiemboon: Tà pi gwɔ́ pajúʼu shwóŋè Ssé júʼ ndàʼ, pi gÿo mmó gie shwóŋè ŋwɛ́ gɔɔn ngie pi gÿo. Tà á té púʼu wɔ́, mbà pi sele fʉte mennɛ́ mí.
en: But   be doers of the word and not hearers only, deceiving yourselves.

ngiemboon: Á nue nyìŋ lɔɔn ńjúʼu shwóŋè Ssé, ḿbiŋ ńké te gÿo páʼ á ne ńzɛ́te wɔ́, mbà ngàŋ gwɔ̌ pɔ́ páʼ nyìŋ gẅie à líe shÿó wé tsɛ̀ɛ gyàshÿó, ńgyá páʼ à gwɔ̌.
en: Because if anyone is a hearer of the word and not a doer, he is like someone looking at his own face   in a mirror.

ngiemboon: Ńdíe tà ńtsẅé jʉʼ, tà fó jʉʼó ńgʉa, ḿbú ńdege páʼ à gwɔ̌.
en: For he looks at himself, goes away, and immediately forgets what kind of person he was.

ngiemboon: Tá nyìŋ gẅie à nyɛte ńtuu nò, á na lepʉ̌ sie tsɔ́ mmó té mǒ zág, é sie é gÿo nyìŋ gwɔ́ ndùnnɛ́, ńzáb ntʉ́m wé mǒ té kʉ́a tà à te gwɔ́ pɔ́ jùʼu ńdege wɔ́, ńgwɔ́ jùʼu ńgÿo, mbà à ge gwɔ́ shÿó mbòŋo na kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie à gÿo.
en: But the one who looks intently into the perfect law of freedom and perseveres in it, and is not a forgetful hearer but a doer who works #— #this person will be blessed in what he does.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńne ńkwaŋa ngie aa na nò Ssé, ncwò wé piŋ te poŋ, mbà à fʉte twó mbùm yé. Awe légwɔ́ na nò Ssé ŋwɛ́, á gwɔ́ pɔ́ sẅɛ̀ɛ.
en: If anyone   thinks he is religious without controlling his tongue,  # 1:26 Ps 34:13; 39:1; 141:3; Jms 3:2–3; 1Pt 3:10 his religion is useless and he deceives himself.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ gẅie e Ssé líe yé á gwɔ́ kwàʼ na nò yé Ssé, tà mmó té na yé zág, aa nyìŋ gẅie à líe púɔ métsé mbɔɔ mepfɔ̌g tsɛ̀ɛ cʉanò yɔ́b, ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ gẅie à pɔ́ɔn mbùm ye, ḿbɔ́g menò njÿó lécʉŋte yé.
en: Pure and undefiled religion before God the Father is this: to look after orphans and widows   in their distress and to keep oneself unstained from the world.  # 1:27 Rm 12:2; 1Jn 5:18
